page.title: 01Ringill and Suisnish
page.content: Half this block consists of sea Loch Slapin and most of the land uncultivated moorland and hill. The areas 1 and 5 have been fenced drained and are now partly covered with forestry commission plantations of conifers, the remainder being uncultivated moorland with a single track road linking the villages of Broadford and Elgol. There is the ancient site of Don Ringill in Square 5. The East of Loch Slapin is all uncultivated moorland with the remains of the old township of Sursuish (square 11 & 12) but with no habitable buildings. A rough track follows the cliffs and is negotiable by Land Rover only. There are several sites of antiquities and small fresh waer lochs popular with fishermen and naturalists. An area of no permanent human habitation but great beauty.
